alert.note: Alert for Lebanon; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lebanon and Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Palmyra, Annville, Minersville, Ashland, Campbelltown, Valley View, Pleasant Hill, Sand Hill, Pine Grove, Cleona, Tremont, Fredericksburg, Tower City, Lavelle, Marlin, Forrestville, Branchdale, Donaldson and Fountain Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
